DataElement.preferredName: Intervention Trial Study Protocol Document Study Subject Allocation Code AllocationType
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A pre-clinical or clinical study in human beings in which individuals are assigned by an investigator based on a protocol to receive specific interventions. The individuals are then followed and biomedical and/or health outcomes are assessed.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.:An organized collection of records that describe a particular body of data._A matter or an individual that is observed, analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, or/and treated in the course of a particular study.:The distribution of resources over various time periods, products, operations, or investments.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation._The code that describes the method of assigning subjects to treatment or control groups.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Intervention Trial Study Protocol Document Study Subject Allocation Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A pre-clinical or clinical study in human beings in which individuals are assigned by an investigator based on a protocol to receive specific interventions. The individuals are then followed and biomedical and/or health outcomes are assessed.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.:An organized collection of records that describe a particular body of data._A matter or an individual that is observed, analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, or/and treated in the course of a particular study.:The distribution of resources over various time periods, products, operations, or investments.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A pre-clinical or clinical study in human beings in which individuals are assigned by an investigator based on a protocol to receive specific interventions. The individuals are then followed and biomedical and/or health outcomes are assessed.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.:An organized collection of records that describe a particular body of data.

Concepts.definition: A pre-clinical or clinical study in human beings in which individuals are assigned by an investigator based on a protocol to receive specific interventions. The individuals are then followed and biomedical and/or health outcomes are assessed.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
A rule which guides how an activity should be performed.
A physical object, or electronic counterpart, that is characterized by containing writing which is meant to be human-readable.

Property.preferredDefinition: A matter or an individual that is observed, analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, or/and treated in the course of a particular study.:The distribution of resources over various time periods, products, operations, or investments.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.

Concepts.definition: A matter or an individual that is observed, analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, or/and treated in the course of a particular study.
The distribution of resources over various time periods, products, operations, or investments.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 4/7/11 - no longer used by BRIDG; released for reuse by COPPA

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The code that describes the method of assigning subjects to treatment or control groups.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not accompanied by another or others; exclusive of anyone or anything else.:A specific treatment plan within a clinical trial that describes the activities a subject will be involved in as he or she progresses through the study.

Concepts.definition: Not accompanied by another or others; exclusive of anyone or anything else.
A specific treatment plan within a clinical trial that describes the activities a subject will be involved in as he or she progresses through the study.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:A study in which the participants are assigned by chance to separate groups that compare different treatments; neither the researchers nor the participants can choose which group.  Using chance to assign people to groups means that the groups will be similar and that the treatments they receive can be compared objectively.  At the time of the trial, it is not known which treatment is best. It is the patient's choice to be in a randomized trial.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
Assignment of subjects by chance to groups that receive different treatments.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A study in which the participants are assigned by chance to separate groups that compare different treatments; neither the researchers nor the participants can choose which group.  Using chance to assign people to groups means that the groups will be similar and that the treatments they receive can be compared objectively.  At the time of the trial, it is not known which treatment is best. It is the patient's choice to be in a randomized trial.

Concepts.definition: Assignment of subjects by chance to groups that receive different treatments.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 7/22/2021wz: released for UML model cleanup project.
